summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted on July 14, 2021, with a Lieutenant from the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The memorandum lists numerous attachments, including interview transcripts, assignment rosters, logs, and photographs related to Epstein's incarceration and the events surrounding his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the OIG investigation. He was housed at MCC New York and found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: A BOP Lieutenant assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, who was voluntarily interviewed by OIG agents on July 14, 2021, regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Senior Special Agent
persons.context: A Senior Special Agent with the DOJ Office of the Inspector General who conducted the voluntary interview of the BOP Lieutenant on July 14, 2021.

persons.name: Special Agent I
persons.context: A Special Agent with the DOJ Office of the Inspector General who, along with a Senior Special Agent, conducted the voluntary interview of the BOP Lieutenant on July 14, 2021.

persons.name: Preparer
persons.context: The individual who prepared this OIG memorandum of investigation. Their specific name is not provided in the text.

persons.name: Reviewer
persons.context: The individual, titled Assistant Special Agent in Charge, who reviewed this OIG memorandum of investigation. Their specific name is not provided in the text.

connections.description: The Senior Special Agent (OIG) interviewed the BOP Lieutenant as part of the official investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The Special Agent I (OIG) participated in conducting the voluntary interview of the BOP Lieutenant.
The Lieutenant was a staff member assigned to the Special Housing Unit where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was housed prior to his death.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent I from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of a BOP Lieutenant regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: Lieutenant's SHU Assignment
events.description: The interviewed BOP Lieutenant was assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit, the day before Epstein was found dead.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General was conducting an official investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A key interviewee was a BOP Lieutenant who was assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found dead.
The memorandum lists 23 attachments as evidence, including interview transcripts, daily assignment rosters, round sheets, count documentation, cell search records, and photographs of Epstein's cell.
One listed attachment is a 'Sign saying Mandatory Epstein Rounds', indicating special protocols may have been in place for monitoring Epstein.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG, and its contents are not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
